alert.note: Alert for Marshall (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 19 at 10:23PM CDT until April 19 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1100 PM CDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL POLK...STORY...NORTHWESTERN MARSHALL AND SOUTHEASTERN BOONE COUNTIES... At 1022 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Cambridge, or 6 miles southwest of Nevada, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Nevada around 1030 PM CDT. Colo around 1040 PM CDT. McCallsburg around 1050 PM CDT. Zearing, Clemons and St. Anthony around 1055 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Zearing, Kelley, Ames Municipal Airport, Alleman, St. Anthony, Maxwell, Clemons and Cambridge. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 97 and 121. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for central Iowa. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
